questions.question: Dr _______ Smith will see you now.
questions.explanation: A full stop is used after abbreviations.

questions.question: Wow _______ I got an A on my test!
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark is used to show excitement or strong emotion.

questions.question: Do you like pizza _______
questions.explanation: A question mark is used at the end of a direct question.

questions.question: The cat slept on the couch _______ The dog slept on the floor.
questions.explanation: A full stop (period) is used to separate two complete sentences.

questions.question: Please bring your pencil _______ eraser _______ and notebook to class.
questions.explanation: Commas are used to separate items in a list.

questions.question: How old are you _______
questions.explanation: A question mark is used at the end of a direct question.

questions.question: Which punctuation mark should be used at the end of this sentence: "I love ice cream"
questions.explanation: A full stop is used at the end of a statement.

questions.question: What punctuation mark goes at the end of "What is your favorite colour"
questions.explanation: A question mark is used at the end of a direct question.

questions.question: Stop _______ Look both ways before crossing the street.
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark is used for emphasis in a command.

questions.question: Choose the correct punctuation for this sentence: "Watch out ___ There's a big puddle"
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark is used to show urgency or warning.

questions.question: What goes at the end of "Please close the door"  ?
questions.explanation: A polite request ends with a full stop.

questions.question: My dog's name is Buddy _______ He is very friendly.
questions.explanation: A full stop is used to separate two complete sentences.

questions.question: Choose the correct punctuation: "Ouch ___ That hurt" ?
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark shows strong emotion or pain.

questions.question: Are you coming to my party on Saturday _______
questions.explanation: A question mark is used at the end of a direct question.

questions.question:
What punctuation mark goes here:
"After school ___ I go to soccer practice"
questions.explanation: A comma separates an introductory phrase from the main sentence.

questions.question: After lunch _______ we will have recess.
questions.explanation: A comma is used after an introductory phrase.

questions.question: Choose the correct punctuation: "My address is 123 Main St ___ New York ___ NY"
questions.explanation: Commas separate parts of an address.

questions.question:
What punctuation mark goes here:
"Yes ___ I would like some cake"
questions.explanation: A comma follows "Yes" at the beginning of a sentence.

questions.question:
What punctuation goes here:
"Tomorrow ___ we have a field trip to the zoo"
questions.explanation: A comma separates an introductory word or phrase from the rest of the sentence.

questions.question:
What goes here:
"Oh no ___ I forgot my lunch"
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark shows strong emotion or surprise.

questions.question: Choose the correct punctuation: "Do you prefer cats ___ dogs ___ or fish"
questions.explanation: Commas separate items in a list, with a question mark at the end of the question.

questions.question: Choose the correct punctuation: "The movie was funny ___ exciting ___ and scary ____"
questions.explanation: Commas separate items in a list, with a full stop at the end of the sentence.

questions.question: What goes at the end of "Can you help me with my homework"
questions.explanation: A question mark is used at the end of a direct question.

questions.question:
Which punctuation mark goes here:
"First ___ put on your shoes"
questions.explanation: A comma follows sequence words like "First" at the beginning of a sentence.

questions.question:
What punctuation goes here:
"Hurry ___ We're going to be late"
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark shows urgency.
